meanings.definition: A person who bends or stoops
meanings.sent1: The stooper picked up the fallen book from the floor.
meanings.sent2: The old man was known in the village as the friendly stooper who helped everyone.
meanings.sent3: The stooper at the park made funny faces while picking up trash.
meanings.sent4: She was a stooper, always willing to lower herself to help others in need.
meanings.sent5: The stooper's back was always sore from constantly bending down to tie shoes for the kids.

meanings.sent1: I had to stooper to look under the bed for my missing sock.
meanings.sent2: The tired farmer would stooper in the fields after a long day of work.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to stooper down to fit through the small gap in the fence.
meanings.sent4: Her heart seemed to stooper with sadness as she bent over to pick up the shattered vase.
meanings.sent5: The tree branches seemed to stooper under the weight of the heavy snow.

meanings.sent1: The stooper of the cat as it prepared to pounce was fascinating to watch.
meanings.sent2: The yoga instructor demonstrated the proper stooper for a calming pose.
meanings.sent3: The stooper of the squirrel as it nibbled on the acorn was quite adorable.
meanings.sent4: The stooper of the old building gave it a mysterious and eerie appearance.
meanings.sent5: The stooper of the flower in the wind made it look like it was bowing to the sun.
